description:
The drinks were nice (you can get a drink for your Asian astrological symbol-- the year of the rat was yummy), and not too badly priced at $8 a cocktail, but the $20 minimum forced me a friend to share a bill and a shot we weren't particularly interested in. 

The place wasn't too hopping on a Saturday night, so if you like a quiet space with seating and a pool table you'd have a good time. I was looking for something a bit more active so I wasn't one hundred percent on board but there was nothing offensive about the night spent there.
author: Liz H.

description:
This isn't a fun neighborhood bar at all. Would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. This bar extends very far back, however, they only have three small TVs up front - so I would not recommend considering this place to watch a game.

Secondly, their service is awful and they are ridiculously overpriced. Guess how much a gin tonic costs...! $16! This isn't a craft cocktail place either, they have ONLY three BAD beers on tap. Pool is $1.50 and darts is $2.00 to play. Not a good time.
author: Trevor W.

description: Great neighborhood corner bar. Quiet with no kids with something to prove. Make this place your last call before you stumble home.
author: Ted J.

description: I came from out of town for a good time, my first time in SF, this place sucks. They charged me $16 for a gin/tonic, Friday night at 12 no one here, waste of time. Will not be back. Very bad service, thanks for nothing.
author: EG E.

description: I wouldn't call this a lounge, but for a dive bar it's pretty cool.  The inside seems clean enough.  There was plenty of seating in the narrow layout of the place. The liquor selection seems about what you'd expect for a dive bar.  We ended up with Tokyo Teas which were strong enough for $11.  Kind of felt them after having 2.  They have one of those cool spin to win a beer/shot wheels.  But the price kind of stopped us from actually playing.  Had it been a bit cheaper it would've been worthwhile.  Overall, it's a decent dive bar along Taravel.  I'd drop by again since the place wasn't too busy.
author: Bryson L.

description: This place is chill and I just met my favorite bartender Jenny. She just makes me lmao. *highfive*
author: Sam Y.

description: Nothing like a bar to hang out in when youre tired from days work. Downing some whiskey and trying to forget half of the idiots you meet during your day on the job. Good people at Dragon lounge. The owners all right.
author: Selby C.

description:
Five star rating for the daytime hours when the Fahey's bartender is there.  That guy is fantastic. 

The evening Dragon Lounge bartender girls are generally good too.  

The changing of the guard in the evening between the two shifts is definitely as legendary as I'd been told.  Well worth coming for that. 

Good liqueur selection, although they could use a few more beers on tap. 

The lounge is kept up very nicely.  It's a pretty place.
author: Joseph B.

description: My favorite bar ever. Good cheap drinks and The staff remembers who you are and makes you feel welcomed and at home.
author: Emma H.

description: Stopped in after getting food down the road. Asked the bartender for a recommendation.  She gave us long islands. While we expected something a bit more original they were very good. The atmosphere is great and the bartender is super friendly. The bartenders watch dog is a bit much though. While back in the pool room the person who wasnt working from what we could tell yelled at the girl who was getting a drink order because she was taking too long. If your in the area stop in and play some pool.
author: Josh F.

description:
Tuesday 3 shots and get 1 free is awesome . And the bartender is pretty cute too. 
Clean bar ( amazingly )
Clean bathroom 

Who knew such a bar would be in this area

Also pool table in the back .
author: Justin I.

description:
Stopped by here for a friend's birthday and the bar is pretty small. I didn't go to the back, so I'm unsure if it is any larger than it looks from the front. My friends and I sat at the first table on the left once you enter the place. The have cute round seats that you can move from one table to another. They also provide dice for their customers to play with as they drink beer. 

I think the service was okay, but felt that the servers/bartenders were a bit rude. I think they're just trying to be friendly with the customers, but to me it came off a bit rude. The owner was a bit rude when checking the IDs too when we have already sat down for more than 5 minutes, and then she comes over to ask for our IDs. Will probably not be back here.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I have no idea how in the world no one has mentioned this in their review yet.

I was taken here by some friends who play a lot of fighting games (like tournaments and shit).
This place was packed for a Tuesday night.

There were many gaming systems set up, had some hardcore gamers bring their own controllers (joysticks depending on who you see).

I'm unsure if they do this every Tuesday but if you're looking for somewhere to do some fighting games, try it out. Though I warn you, these guys look like they're used to doing mass amount of pwning.

One thing I can't really get over is how expensive the drinks were... Like it's Tuesday night, are you freaking serious?
author: Winè C.

description: This place smells funny. Moreover, the drinks were mediocre at best and were appropriately cheap. The service was disgusting. Highly not recommended. This my first negative review.
author: Sammy S.

description:
Had a thoroughly good time at this bar :D Came here on a Sunday night (not an alcoholic, I swear) and ordered a pretty good amount of drinks. We had the starburst (a recommendation from the bartender), some blue dragon drink, some beers, and a shot of... something intense. Well, whatever it was, it was good! It was all good! And I was thoroughly drunk after it all :D

Bartender was pretty nice. I left her a larger tip because she actually talked to me, haha. I think I've gotten so used to bartenders in the mission/marina/polk that are just mass producing drinks and ridiculous speeds that I've forgotten that bartenders are actually people, not just drink-making robots. 

I'll def come back! I really liked it. I'm happy that a nice little lounge is near my place!
author: Jade R.

description:
So I wasn't expecting much when I first walked in.  Typical dive bar...not that many people when we got there...we ordered and they came out with our drinks really fast.

Then the two chick bartenders started drinking.  Like their eyes got small drinking & they forgot they were working...they just started socializing.

We were ready to leave & my friend went to close his tab.  He tried calling the girls, he made eye contact with the girls...nothing for 20min.  Finally another one of our friends got up & yelled at them so we could leave...finally they closed out our tab.

Oh yeah, you can only use a cc for tabs over $20

Don't expect much, except for cheap drinks with crappy service.
author: Trisha S.

description:
UPDATE: 

This guy really has the balls to comment on my review and say I'm ghetto and that I have no class? I'm sorry, but there were witnesses that heard the whole conversation. And yes, F bombs sure were exchanged. You might need to check with what your bartenders are saying because I can guarantee that what I left in my original review is 100% true. I used to work at a bar and I got along with people just fine - as I do your mom. I love Reggie and she's never had an issue with me. Goes to show I am NOT "ghetto, a bully, rude, inconsiderate and classless." - very "classy" of you to diss me on yelp, BTW.

I also won't deny that I have gotten into a fight at Dragon Lounge. (goes to show.. it's dangerous here, DON'T GO!) And just an FYI, when I did get into that fight at Dragon Lounge, it was because one of your male customers threatened to punch me FOR NO REASON. Yes, your beloved customer - who apparently didn't get kicked out for randomly threatening to punch a girl in the face, but the girl who got threatened is a "bully" for defending herself.

If you really think I'm stupid, are you some type of genius? How is bringing in my "outside" drink to your bar similar to bringing outside food to a restaurant. It's NOT like I brought my own alcohol to your bar. I brought TEA, this in no way, shape, or form affects your sales/business. I guess "small minded" people such as myself would definitely get drunk off of hot milk tea.

And lastly, I did not "throw" my drink at you. But to be honest, I wish I did.

Good one, advertise to get people to go to Dragon Lounge to support you in "opposing against bullies like Lily".
Hey! You guys are welcome, I got you guys a free shot ;)
author: Lily K.

description:
I was here for pool league night and they had the Giants NLCS game on the projector screen in the back room where they have the pool table. "Props to the bar for having it on" I thought. The Giants proceed to win the National League Pennant, and the bar immediately turns off the game. We ask the bartender if they can please turn it back on, and they respond, "The game is over." HELLO! THE GIANTS JUST WON THE FREAKING PENNANT!! They're going to the World Series and we can't watch any highlights?!? I've heard numerous anecdotes from my friends and also have read numerous bad reviews on here about their horrid customer service. I didn't pay much attention until tonight. Terrible, terrible bar. They have a sign here that says, "World Famous Cocktails. World Class Bartenders." Definitely false advertising.

Post review edit: The owner got a call, came to the back room and asked who was "Samuel". I spoke up and she proceeded to tell me, "If you don't like, it you can leave." Really professional lady.
author: Samuel F.

description:
Good ol' Dragon Lounge. My friends and I have been going here periodically over the last three years and we've always had an interesting experience each time here. So when I moved out to Taraval a couple months ago, I knew I'd be likely to stop by here more often. Little did I know that I'd quickly become a regular to the extent that I did.

So the first thing you'll notice about Dragon Lounge is the chill atmosphere and the friendly bartenders. My friends and I often come here to catch up or just relax with some drinks after a meal somewhere in the city. The staff members are all very friendly and I've even become acquainted with many of the bartenders that have worked there over the years. They're very easy to talk to and will even drink with you should you need a drinking buddy. With numerous TVs at the bar, we can usually watch whatever game or show interests us with ease. This was especially important to me during the NHL playoffs when many bars in SF would only play the Giants games or the NBA playoff games despite my beloved Sharks playing that night in the Stanley Cup Playoffs. 

Now should you ever get hungry while drinking there, the owner is really chill about us ordering food from elsewhere and eating inside while we enjoy the drinks there. They even have some sort of partnership with Yelo Gelato Crepe Café next door so that if you order food from there, they'll walk over and serve it to you inside Dragon Lounge so you don't have to leave your drinks while waiting for your food to be ready. The best part is that they usually stay open until Dragon Lounge closes so you'll always have it as an option for some late night snacks to sober up on. They even now serve hot dogs and hamburgers on their menu! "Hot Dog Coming Soon"...no longer. It has arrived and dang is it delicious!!!

Overall, if you're living in the Sunset, especially near Taraval, you should definitely come and kick it at Dragon Lounge. Awesome bartenders/staff, numerous TVs, decent drink prices, and friendly regulars, what more can you ask for from your neighborhood bar. If you do stop by, be sure and try their signature drink, the Dragon Extreme. It's like an AMF but much more delicious. Or for the brave few out there, try the "Gaj", a drink named after me. It's basically a combination of 4 Dragon Extremes put together into a Giant pitcher with a cherry on top for kicks. While you can share it with you friends, I applaud those brave enough to try it on their own. See you at Dragon Lounge!
author: Gajan K.

description:
First time here last night with my cousin and I must say on a Saturday night there were not that many girls on site besides the bartendtresses and us Hahah. The drinks are cheap; they require a $20 min charge if you card though. Crystal was tending to us the whole evening we were there and I give her  plus plus plus points for being so attentive especially when one crazy f.o.b. was trying to get at us...

So I started with a strawberry daiquiri and an amf for my cousin. Both drinks were really good and on the spot with alcohol content! Then the whole crazy scene of free flowing drinks gets sent to us at our table and crystal won't tell us who the person was!!! 

Fun atmosphere when you get your fade on but can be awkward if you're not very sociable.. mainly Asians who come here, pool table in the back room. Plenty of bar seatings and booth seatings! Age gap for groups here can range from 20s to who knows how old those people were... 

Towards the end of our stay the owner came and introduce himself and noticed it was our first time and asked us how we think of the place. I must say Jason, I am definitely coming back again to kick it!:
author: Anita L.

description:
Dragon Lounge is far from the ghetto so the boys in the 'hood aren't so noticeable here. (maybe cuz the parkside police station nearby is a downer).  the scene is more yuppified but not geek.

there may be an informal dress code here as the  the i.d. checker at the door gives you and your i.d. the eye.

nice formal bar, not really a dive. eye candies all around. drinks not cheap though.  very roomy here. only ventured here a few times in the past. parkings not so easy here sometimes.

mostly younger college type crowds when i went.
author: Victor G.

description:
Although this bar has a nice location (neighborhood-y, peaceful, relaxed) there were certain other parts of my experience here that without a doubt will prevent me from ever coming back. As many reviews here have stated, the bar tenders are awful. So rude. When I was there, an old man was the bartender and he seemed to getting drunk with about 6 of his old friends. I did not stay long but he 1) made fun of how I was dressed (which caused his friends to burst out laughing) and 2) made sexual comments about me when my back was turned and used the term "hanky panky" (which again, caused all of his friends to burst out laughing.) I actually was not dressed in revealing clothing AT ALL, he was just obnoxious, drunk, and trying to make his friends laugh. 
All of that aside, the crowd here is anything but young and exciting. The facilities were okay but not the best. But even if the drinks and crowd were excellent, I would not return here ever again because of the public humiliation and disrespect. Fail Dragon Lounge.
author: Anastasia B.

description: Came back after a year of not being here, and I definitely have to say that this place is growing on me. The drinks come cheap and flow freely, and the bartenders are very affable/slightly crazy. The clientele is eclectic, to say the least, with one guy who dresses like the Mario Brothers in on the weekends (I think his name is Mike) and several other notable regulars. TVs are always set to local sports, and there are cushy seats to just kick it on. There is also a jukebox and pool tables (if you're not too inebriated to play). They also give out free pretzels to help you sober up (trust me, you'll need it). Careful about asking for water, though. You're going to get looked at like a pansy.
author: Danny C.

description:
The Sunset watering hole. Went here two weeks ago after a few years of not popping in. I remember the street outside used to look like a scene out of Fast & Furious 10 years ago (when the movie came out).

I've got to say though, the bartenders and the old woman have been pretty nice every time I came out. I suspect most of the time the girls are trashed. They pour fatty shots and the prices are decent.

I can't say I would go out of my way to hit up Dragon Lounge because I live in Millbrae, but this place is just what it is - your local watering hole in the Sunset.

Get drunk, walk home.
author: Doug R.

description: Dragon Lounge is awesome, the people are great, the bartenders are hot and the atmosphere is second to none. Good vibes good tunes good people!
author: Brady W.

description: Great local bar! Best part about local bars are the prices, which are very inexpensive. I love their drink specials on Tuesday nights. The Bartenders are super sweet and friendly. They have a pool table in the back, which makes a chill night even better.
author: Anastasia N.

description: Great bar in the Sunset.  Jason and Reggie have always been nice to me.   Love the cute bartenders.
author: Robert M.

description: I found my new favorite drink, the Sleeping Dragon. How good is it? You're just gonna have to go in and try it out for yourself! :)
author: Allen T.

description: Drinks were overpriced and tasted horrible, bartender didn't care when I brought it to their attention. Wont be returning anytime soon.
author: Melvin G.

description:
Update: DO NOT GO HERE. They make false charges on your cc, give you fake liquor, and skimp on alcohol for mixed drinks. 

They actually OVERCHARGED my Credit Card!! We purchase a 6 pack of beer which they charged $38, and two cran/vodkas for $31. Yuck. Hopefully my cc company can settle this. 

Ugh. From the customers to the service to the skimping on alcohol. I should've gotten the hint when I ordered two cran-vodkas with greygoose and they literally filled the cup with ice, then with cran and barely barely gave any greygoose. They proceeded to charge $8 each. 

Then, when I ordered a shot of greygoose, they took a grey goose bottle that had fake liquor that was most definitely filled with really really cheap vodka. it was DISGUSTING!!! We resorted to bottles of beer after!!
author: Yue Z.

description:
Street fighter Mondays? I'm there.

Nice staff, decent drinks, a good neighborhood Asian bar.
author: Mercutio k.

description: Good neighborhood spot with friendly staff. Almost never crowded and the two girls who bartend on weekends are great!
author: Megan S.

description: Came here on a Thursday night to watch the World Series. I thought this place would be a dive bar, but I was pleasantly surprised by the interior of this place. It was very nice and classy with a couple sofas on the side. The place was pretty dead on Thursday so I am interested to see how it is on a Friday or Saturday. My favorite decor in the place: autograph photo of Jackie Chan.
author: Cindy A.

description: A great neighborhood hang out with a fun pool table and dart board. (Please replace darts though!) drinks are good and the bartenders are lovely.
author: Nicole K.

description:
Been here in the daytime, but never been here at night so I didn't quite know what to expect.  When a good friend of mine told me he was coming here to shoot pool with a group of friends last night, I decided to check it out.

Ended up having a fantastic time, drinking and shooting pool.  My game was totally off for some reason last night, but as always I still had a lot of fun.  The bartender, Gloria, was sweet and really wonderful.  When a bunch of us really got into our pool games, she actually came to the back room to take our drink orders.

Had to smile when I saw a drink called The Euge on the menu and was happily reminded that this is one of his haunts.  Looked for him, but was disappointed that I didn't see him this time.  Would have loved to have finally met him after knowing him on Yelp for so long.

Like I always say...each bar is like it's own individual world.  Always fun to explore the universe of alcohol.
author: Roy N.

description: This place is dece. Nothing to go crazy over. I do like the pool table in the back though. The table and sticks are in much better condition than I've seen at any other bar.
author: Michael L.

description:
After six years of living in down the street and peering in suspiciously as I walked past, I finally checked this place out last night with some friends, and what a pleasant surprise!

Bigger than it looks, with all sorts of seating and a pool table/game room kind of space in the back. Extremely friendly staff, from the bartenders to the owner (?) who was being very sociable with all the regulars.

There are a lot of TVs, but none of them were blaring or too intrusive when I was there. The only other downside was the bathroom could maybe use a little work (it's clean, but a little beat up)

Now that I know, I will definitely be back. It was friendly and comfortable enough that I can actually picture dropping in on my own.

Bonus; they let you order food from Yelo, next door, and even have a menu handy.
author: Espana S.

description:
I love the Dragon Lounge.  Cheap prices, strong drinks, and friendly service.  There's a nice mix of seating: plenty of space at the bar, but also a bunch of little sofa/cushion areas that give a semi-private feel.

They also have a beautiful tournament grade Diamond pool table in the back.
author: Eric S.

description:
A lounge on Taravel?  Seriously?  If you said a dive, I'd be more likely to believe you.  But a lounge?

Yeah, I was totally surprised to find this place in the neighborhood.
Dragon Lounge is roomy, serves decent drinks, and has a real friendly vibe to it.
There is also a pool table, darts, and a juke box with good sounds in the back.

Overall, I liked it.
I'm giving it 3.5 stars but rounding down since I need one more visit to verify.

Before I forget, I have to apologize to the bartender.
I get a little talky when drunk, and the more intoxicated the more I talk.
So Beware.
The worst thing is I inevitably ends up babbling about books.
And last night was no exception.
From what I'm told, I was either rambling about Derrida's contribution to deconstruction or why kids likeThe Story of Farts.
http://gravybread.files.wordpress.com/2007/04/fart-book-small.jpg
And when asked why no one stopped my incoherent lecture, they said they were either too hammered or too busy laughing or both.  Thanks.
Once again, sorry.
author: Dan B.

description:
A fairly quite, neighborhood bar. Clean, open, and has a fairly nice ambiance. Bartenders are really friendly too. As mentioned below, the $20 min credit does suck since I never carry much cash on me. Not very much happening at this place but if your looking for a quite scene to enjoy a few beers and catch up with friends, this is the place to go. 

Oh and street parking is on a hill which is a real pain in the middle of the night when your buzzed.
author: Alex C.

description:
I've been here a few times because it seems to be a good spot to catch up with friends with a few drinks, and recommended it to my friend because we would eat along Taraval from time-to-time. 

Dragon Lounge is a great place to grab a drink and watch the game if you're in the area. There are multiple televisions around the bar and lounge type chair for those who just want to sit back. There is a pool table in the back room with a screen and projector. They offer pretzels for those drinking and they partnered with Yelo Gelato Crepe Café next door to deliver food if they're open (was closed the Tuesday I went). 

They definitely have their regulars and a decent variety of drink menu, but I only came for the beer. Good eye candy definitely helps when you buy a drink. Also, Jackie Chan picture is sitting on the coffee maker, so big ups for them. It's more of a convenient location, but not a drive far out of the way spot.
author: Casey L.

description:
Like Yimou Zhang's- Curse of the Golden Flower, the greatest special effect of Dragon Lounge are all the asian bartenders with massive, opulent cleavage.

Don't try jumpin in your car "buzzed" as right up the street is an SFPD station.  

Oh yes, order the euge...good times boss!
author: omar b.

description:
I think this is the first bar I've been where the bartenders have to consult a book on how to make a drink.  They usually have ESPN on the flat screen when I'm sitting on the backless chairs (ottomans?), so I'm not complaining.  The bartenders are lookers, which is always a plus.

The back room has a pool table, but I've never set foot in there seeing how it's always occupied.
author: Jenny L.

description: I like the place. It's casual and relaxed. The bartender Anna is cool. I mostly drink beer, so I can't judge the drinks. But so far, so good.
author: Matt H.

description: Only decent bar in the Sunset that has the least chances of getting shot. This place has a good rotation of young bartenders, the older lady must be the owner. All the younger ones would work there a year max and complain about her most of the time..
author: M C.

description:
Dragon lounge.... hmmm, so much potential.

Bartender: She was amazing, very nice, friendly, great customer service and mixed my friend and I some mean drinks. Love to meet good staff in bars and restaurants as I too work in the industry. 

Atmosphere/Decor: Nice feel... lots of cool lighting, respectable jukebox, I think a pool table? All the clientele seemed cool too.

Drinks: We had a couple of beers and then ordered one of their scorpion  bowls. I guess the bowls had met their demise a while ago so the bartender made us a condensed version in a glass. It was really good and really strong. Very tasty!

Now... why only three stars? The owner. My friend ordered a Guinness and it was bad. Their Nitro tap was messed up or something. Both my buddy and I work in a restaurant and we know how Guinness on tap should be... So the bartender was willing enough to replace it, but the owner stepped in and said no. In customer service you always help the customer out if the item was bad, usually even if the customer is crazy and the food/drink is fine you will be offered a replacement. I've been a bar manager, the cost of giving us one replacement beer would have been worth the return visits we would have made. So 3 stars for the bartender, atmosphere, and mixed drinks.... But not going back due to the owner and his poor regard for customer service.
author: Christina R.

description:
If your down in the dumps, have a friend take you to this place because after the yummy Chocolate Cake last night, my belly was warm and I was good to go.  Went on a Saturday.
This is definitely a quiet place around 10pm.  The pool table was open during this time.  When I first walked in, the first thing I thought was, "This place is so calming."  It was cozy and friendly, and the girls who work there really care about their customers.  They filled my water without me asking--but rather because they thought I was getting a little red and tired.
Once it hits 11-12, people start flooding in, but it wasn't super loud.  Rather gave off a warm feeling.  They have game machines, no dancing, and put on the mainstream music on their jukebox.  Yes, there were more Asian guys than girls, but it being SF it was a number of mixed races and ages.  Definitely give this place a chance.  4 stars for it being a good place to wind down.
author: Janet T.

description:
There's really only one question for a place called Dragon Lounge: Asian bar...or AZN bar?

Seems to be a bit of both, actually.  Like the place where the asian clubbing crowd goes on their off nights.  Sure, modern R&B is king on the jukebox, but everyone is just here to chat, shoot pool, even watch football.

Choosing a cocktail here was a bit odd (if only I'd done my homework I could've ordered the Euge -- total bonus star for that).  They didn't seem to know how to make an old-fashioned or a white russian , though I saw lots of rum & cokes getting made, and various things with lots of sodas, liqueurs, and maraschino cherries.  Hardly anyone was drinking beer.  In the end we opted for Manhattans, which were done well but pricey for Parkside.  Decor is nice, my only complaint is that the lights behind the bar are too bright.

So, yet another contender for my local bar of choice.  Sadly, I think I fit in more in the Inner Sunset, but from the reviews, Dragon Lounge seems like a great place to run into some of my fellow west-side Yelpers.  Do you think if you order a Euge, it will summon him?
author: Wes M.

description:
Eh. Where else would my alcoholic friends drink on a Monday night?


I only go for the nudie picture game. It's the best game ever. EVER! One day, I will have the high score on one of the machines..
You will sit there and think to yourself "oh, this is that game Susy Effing C mentioned in her review. Yeah I guess i'll give it a shot."

BADDOW!!


#1 SUSY EFFING C

and you'll say to yourself...

"geezus christ, i wonder how much money she spent on this damn game"
author: Susy C.

description:
Love the place the people there are nice and kind, went there ever since march when i broke up with my gf that time, many drink to pick from...luckly after i drink so much, i did not started talking werid...just super duper dizzy.

pro:nice environment, can ppl new ppl to chart if they are not drunk

con:i dont know any yet
author: Calvin T.

description:
If you live in the Sunset, then you know that there isn't too much to do (other than eat Asian desserts) during the night. The Dragon Lounge doesn't seem to attract much attention on the outside because it's rather hidden. In fact, I used to take the L Taraval every day and I thought it was some hip dentistry with some cool lights on the outside. It isn't located on a bar street but there really isn't anything else around other than residential houses and the library across the street.

But trust me, this is where you want to come at night if you're in the Sunset and you just want to hang and kick it. The bartenders here are all super chill and friendly, they'll always personally come over and ask you if everything is OK and if you need any more drinks. 

The drinks are also very reasonably priced. We always order a pitcher and it'll always come out to about 5 bucks a person. They have televisions all along the top of the bar and a pool table in the back.

I think the Sunset has just gotten a little bit cooler for me after discovering the Dragon Lounge.
author: David W.

description:
I know I'm Asian and this is an Asian club but I rarely go into them.  I don't have exclusively Asian friends so it makes it hard when everyone there except the bouncer is of the same skin tone as me.

My friends and I went there because Shannon Arms was completely full of college kids and Grandma's had some people playing at the pool table.  Dragon lounge had absolutely no one in the back where the pool table was and no one wanted to play except us.  This was great since my friends and I are terrible and on average take 20-30 minutes per game.

The music was fun and something I could dance to.
author: Ashley I.

description:
Dearest Jameson,

Last night, I needed you so bad. I went to Dragon Lounge and ordered you from a delightful bartender.  She also served us some pretzels to add to our interaction.  I watched highlights from the Niners game and kept going after you to ease my thoughts.

I looked over and noticed the owner eating soup.. . damn that smelled so good. I looked over on the other side, and was entertained by some drunken old asian men.  

On the other hand, you were great.  We laughed, we talked about everything.. I vented... I had a great MONDAY NIGHT. LOL..

You entertained me so well, that I didnt realized I had work in a few hours.. Cheers to you!
author: Cel A.

description:
I came here a few weeks ago with my roommate who wanted to drink beer and watch football. We ordered some beers and some wings. The wings were some microwaved shit from Costco, not very good. Beers were $4 a pint, not too bad.

There's the main bar area then a decently sized back room that wasn't in use, but it has a pool table and dart boards and some more seating.

The old lady who runs the bar is not very friendly, but she was training this super sweet (and really cute) younger girl who, hopefully, will be serving more often now.
author: Joseph N.

description:
Ehh.. No

Came here after a horrible experience at Fizzee's. Dinner was great but then struck out at 2 bars. Our group took it as a sign and called it a night early.  Thank goodness for friends. You can always make the most of a situation as long as you're with good company.

I use to frequent this place 5 years ago and it was awesome! (Ahh college days) There was a nice diverse crowd. Bartenders were cute and could hold a conversation.  NO DRAMA. It was all good.

Fast forward to 2010 and WOW! This place has changed. The guys here look like they're ready to kick some ass!  Whose ass? I have no idea but they look like they have a chip on their shoulder.  Ease up will ya?  There's nothing worse than yellow-on-yellow crime. =P

The prices are decent. The bartenders are not so chatty and they dont look like they enjoy what they're doing. God help em'

Its over run by Asians. ABC's and FOB's.  Not that there's anything wrong with this. I mean, I love my peoples but  it use to be a nice mix. What happened?

There were a lot of people playing these drinking games with their fingers.  I think the idea is that you get to 15? Loser drinks? Uh.. I dont have to lose a game to drink b/c I'll do it willingly. =P 

I'll always remember the good times Dragon Lounge.  I'm not a big fan of your "new you".  Perhaps we'll cross paths again in say 2015?
author: Sun T.

description:
A few months back I made a phone call to a local bar to inquire about having a gathering with friends; we would use some of their equipment and a lot of their space on Monday night.  The bar owner happily granted us that permission right on the spot.

Fast forward to today:  The Dragon Lounge is OUR Monday nights, and it is the most entertaining place to be as a video gamer in the entire city, given that you're 21+ of course.  :)  The bartenders are wonderful, the owners are gracious/respectful, and the crepery next door DELIVERS both figuratively and literally.  The place is comfortable, very clean/tasteful, and the music is never too loud.  I can't recommend this place enough.

If you are around 24th and Taraval on a Monday night, don't hesitate to poke your head in and witness what we do.  It's definitely a spectacle to behold, and it wouldn't be possible without open-minded and gracious owners who understand how important their customers are.  A+++

-A
author: Luke E.

description:
Cheap drinks, plenty of seats and you can have food delivered from the crepe place next door. 

Now, this is not the kind of place I would seek out, but I was invited here for some spontaneous drinks for a friends birthday. I liked that we could sit down, have some drinks and when we got hungry, order food from the place next door and have it delivered to your seat. That's what I'm talking about.

This is definitely more of a neighborhood type bar and I liked that. Very laid back and chill. The bartenders were nice and came by our table often to take empty glasses away and ask if we needed anything. While I won't make the voyage from Oakland, I'd come back here if invited.
author: Joshua C.

description:
One of the lesser bars on the Taracrawl.

I've only been in here once, but believe you me, it was one times too many.  The interior has this sleazy lounge lizard decor, only large cube sitting areas, awkward.  

And a strange regular crowd.  Will skip this one next time.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Fun, clean, right by the house.  Fairly good prices, my only down fall here is the draft beers.  I jus feel the ladies behind the bar should be taught how to pour a proper pint.  There is a right and a wrong way, 10 for 10 my pint hasn't been poured proper.  Oh well get a bottle!  I'll be back more and more and then even again.
author: Mikey F.

description:
An Asian-run dive bar playing Metallica's greatest hits, it was definitely a strange feel stepping inside.  Don't get me wrong... Metallica is my favorite band of all-time, and they played my favorite song of all time... so the Metallica part was NOT strange even in the slightest.  What was?  The conservative looking elderly Asian woman running the show at the end of the bar.  She stayed somewhat inconspicuous until she needed to come busting out with her ID card scanner.

Anyhoo, the seats were lounge-style... sharing backrests with someone else who might be sitting behind you.  By backrests, I mean, leaning on someone's back as a backrest.. in other words... unnnncomfortable.

The beer selection on tap was pretty small, but then again, I didn't expect much from a bar of this size.  The beer's taste?  Eh, it was as expected of beer in a bottle.

I ordered their 12 pc Honey BBQ Wings.  Mmm Mmm Costco goodness!  Even though I know the wings are from Costco (I'd be willing to put money on it!), I was still happy that they only charged $7 for 12 wings where most other bars would probably charge closer to $10, if not more!  Costco or not, the wings were good.

The bartenders / waitresses didn't really come by the other seating areas too frequently... like, if you wanted to refill your glass of water, you'd kinda have to go up to the bar and ask... even if you were sitting down to a 12 pc Costco meal.  

Eh, I'm not all that jazzed about this place.  I'm more jazzed about their next door neighbor, "Yelo."  But that's for another review.

3 Stars... sorta.
author: Johnson N.

description: Chill spot with tons of tvs, sofa seats, very well kept pool table in the back (away from all the noise), and a picture of jackie chan sitting on top of the coffee machine. What more can you ask for?
author: Derrick W.

description: I felt like I took a step into a bar in chinatown. I was the only American there, however the drinks were strong and the bartender was cute. Great if you want to change it up.
author: D K.

description:
This place is hilarious!! First off they have semi-hot asian bartender girls wearing short shorts behind the bar! :) I have bartended and ... doing it in short shorts.... I can't imagine... pretty sticky I would guess. :) 

The cocktails are measured down to the drop  .... so it's not the best place to booze it up ... but the beers are reasonably priced. 

There is also a huge booth section way in the back for you and your friends to take over... permitting that the asians have not already claimed it :) 

You are right across the street from the Police station so lots of cops come in here I suspect... although I did see dudes puffin blunts on the side of the building ... but it is SF.

Once you are good and drunk .. there is a park up the street (across from the police station) where you can ride the swings.... but be quiet :)
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Good drinks and good bartenders. The price of the drinks are alright but the bartenders totally took care of us. Heidi and MG are the greatest!

This place is small and cramped though. I will admit I thought it was even smaller, but going in, I realized it was just narrow and long. There's a back room with a pool table.
author: Paul V.

description: This is a pretty cool neighborhood bar. Very homey and inviting. Jenny always takes care of me. She is a great bartender!!!
author: Patrick M.

description:
I'm a little sad to hear how many girls have had The Euge before me. When I was offered The Euge, I thought I was special, but after reading all these other reviews, I realized that I am just another naive girl who was tempted by The Euge. 

Thank goodness for the hawt and super sweet Miss Amanda, who had Don Julio with me 3 times afterward. After that, I forgot all about The Euge. 

I prefer those of a Latin persuasion anyway.
author: Connie C.

description:
Oh Yelp i can't believe this bar is actually on here....

I used to be a bartender here...i loved it...
let me clear up some things...
1. drinks are dirt cheap..and the bartenders know how to POUR..we were never shady...you want it irish..we make it irish
2. bartenders are well over 21..so no..Jason doesn't hire any youngins
3.the crowd is..well Typically ASIAN...however you do get your occassional SF STATE BASKETBALL Players...Yum =)

otherwise this bar is great...bartenders are always super nice and try and get to know you....TRUST ME =)...they know just what to give you when your day isn't going so great...


downside...
-it's down the street from the police station...yet..cops have better things to do then post..so don't fret
-sometimes nasty FOB's hit on you and try to throw money in your face..NO BUENO...we cannot be bought....my reason for 4 stars 


update....

all the b*tches that keep on hating on the bartenders need to stop....it's not our fault why you can't get any attention....try a wonder bra :)
author: Jarren A.

description: Nice bar in the sunset district.  Jen is awesome, she is very courteous, attentive and makes one hell of a drink.  Definitely stop in to say hi to her.
author: Lai L.

description:
Back in the Midwest, we don't have "Asian bars" (though there are "Asian clubs"), so Dragon Lounge was a bit of a curiosity to me...would I be self-conscious about not fitting into some stereotype of an Asian woman? Naw, this is a totally chill, spacious bar where I feel right at home (man, I lurve SF). I've said it before, and I'll say it again..I LOVE places where there's a variety of things for people to do. You can...

- Hustle your friends at the pool table.

- Order up some R&B and soul tunes on the jukebox (holy crap they have Al Green, Marvin Gaye, THE ISLEY BROTHERS!..but I gotta say, they could use more of the early funktastic Isley Bros stuff).

- Get your erotic video game on w/ PhotoHunt.

- Watch the local sports team or Miss Hawaiian Tropic competition.

- Drink a Euge (deceptively potent under a guise of fruity sweetness...I'm just sayin' what the drink's like!).

Minus one star b/c I don't like getting carded and having my Illinois driver's license inspected by not just one, but two people...and I think that there should be at least one hot Asian dude behind the bar. Some of us have our own fabulous boobies thankyouverymuch.
author: Steph P.

description:
Hot bartender?  Check.
Cocktail named after one of my favorite Yelpers?  Check.
People bringing their own stick to play pool?  Check.
Jukebox loaded with killer songs?  Check.
Stumbling distance from my house?  Nope.  Four stars it is.
author: phil h.

description:
On the topic of memories [see my reviews re: Spanish Table & Ocean Beach], the bouncer at the door of the Dragon Lounge [deemed "DL" by those who frequent it] sure has a good one. After fewer than a handful of visits, I've been recognized and remembered. Of course, why should that surprise me? I'm not one of the many Asian males that passes through those doors, and for an Asian female, I'm actually at least eye-to-eye when he's sitting on that stool outside. 

I'll never venture to this bar alone. Not mixed enough a crowd for my tastes. It's not exactly in my neighborhood either. But I don't mind it so much. Where else can I flirt with the cute bartenders, indulge in my R&B-appreciating ways, and watch UFC all at the same time? 

$20 credit minimum - BOO. Others have mentioned it being crowded, but I've never had problems finding a place to sit. Good timing, perhaps?

3.5 stars.
author: Tinna H.

description:
A few AZN thugs in the back but the drinks, the bartendress' boobs and company are good

The only thing I like more than man on man action:
Euge on Omar action.
author: Mary F.

description:
2 times in 2 days.  I see why the locals like it so much.  It's dark with lots of seating, hot bartenders and a pool table.  The jukebox is funny with old booty music, blues and jazz.  I tried the Euge, which was a sweet rum drink with a cherry in it.  That still makes me laugh.  The drinks in general were pretty stiff though.

The best part of visit #2 was someone doing a flare and the continuing (mis)education of Seong.  I learned something about neck popping, a guy with a ready supply of condoms and Plan B's and other biological and anatomical facts I need to google the accuracy of.  However, I was deemed Plan B worthy.  That's nice.  I made a bunch of booty call texts (all of  you are very special to me).  Then some little Korean guy picked me up and had me screaming like a sorority girl.  Wow, I guess he really is strong.
author: Seong P.

description:
A friend of mine knew the owner of this place so we decided to show up and show some love.  It was another friend of our's bday that night so we dragged him along with 10 others to celebrate.  After we lined up and everyone got and paid for their drinks, my friend ordered a coke because she doesn't drink.  The owner charges her for it.

They were friends.  She pulls me and a bunch of others in to show support.  We all buy a ton of drinks.  She gets  a coke.  He charges her.  I was offended.  Never went back.  Never will be back.
author: G-Man ..

description:
Dragon's may not lounge here but more likely than not you can spot a Euge here.  If he isn't here and you have the urge to have a Euge in your hand then you can just order one from the lovely ladies behind the bar.

I have a feeling that if I lived nearby this would be my *Cheers*.  The spot where I could go, sit at the bar and enjoy a few drinks on a random weeknight.  It's too clean to be considered a dive bar but it's also not the type of place that people are going to cross a bridge for which is probably what keeps this place a gem for the locals who can enjoy the place whenever they want.
author: Luis M.

description:
AH! Remember Thirsty Thursdays?

I celebrated two consecutive birthdays there. The bartenders are real nice! Nice intimate setting.

Yeah, it's true that it's always full of Asians but consider that the owner is also the owner of a martial arts school, the name of the bar sounds Asian, and the bar is in Sunset, which majority of the residents are Asian. That pretty much explains it.

If you ever go there, order the Euge! Yeah, it's a bitch drink but it's real good. Or for those more hardcore people out there, the Flaming Dragon. 

Watch, I'll have a drink named after me one day!
author: Nance W.

description:
This place keeps getting better and better. 

Of course, I have Euge to thank for. Bars are always a hit or miss with me, but with great shots and some great friends, you'll never leave unhappy.

Note: Hot Bartenders helps too. 

*See Euge showing off the goods - clicky

http://www.flickr.com/photos/stanleyk/383040623/in/set-72157594523372931/
author: Stanley K.

description:
This place is actually pretty ghetto. It's a mainly Asian crowd  (not that I mind) and you have the usual gangster looking guys playing Chinese games and screaming at one another. The only reason I have come to this place a couple of times is because all the other bars have been so packed that none of us wanted to deal with the craziness and we know that there is always a free table at this place. Their "special" cocktails really aren't that special and the girls (bartenders) really aren't that cute. Maybe I'm not a good judge because I'm a girl...who knows?

Update: I received a message from Jennylynnchan C., who up until this point (2/8/08) only has one review which happens to be about how cute the bartenders are...what a coincidence, who was clearly upset that I thought the bartenders weren't that cute. Oh well, I'm sorry I didn't think you were cute and that I hurt your feelings. Get over it.
author: Diane M.

description:
Nobody can deny the importance of a first impression and my first thoughts of this place upon walking in. "Dam...wish this was more conveniently located to my apartment." 

This was a last minute decision to go out to Euge's B-day extravaganza and, as usual, I'm glad I made it out. The place is totally non-divey. Super clean interior w/ lots of seating and tables. The jute box was full of good music, the drinks were "ok" priced (could have been cheaper as it was not in downtown, but not outrageous), the bartender was well endowed, Euge was well intoxicated, and the pool table in the back was in good condition as well. Just minus one star for being all the way in the Sunset District. 

Overall It was a good night out. I really need to learn more about the L line though....I almost got stranded around West Portal.
author: Angelo F.

description:
Pretty decent place...

I'll admit, I liked it a lot more before when there were more bartending eye-candy....

It has a pool table in the back which is pretty cool, a dart board, and it also serves food...plus some TV screens, often on some sporting show/event...

I wouldn't mind coming here to just chill with the fellas...
author: Mike V.

description:
Okay...explain this one to me. 

Hard core azn bar.....

Hoochie ass azn bartenders....

Pool table......

In the Outer Sunset.....

and

Motown and R&B jukebox???  Really??  Random.

Booze...gotta love it!  So three stars.
author: Jay H.

description:
i better not say anything bad about this place or EJ will surely kill me... :P

Came here last night for drinks.. This is EJ's home away from home.. His 'hood... His beat... whatever you want to call it... 

This is the weirdest neighborhood bar ever... the decor is a little weird, but it works... the bartenders are hot and very friendly... and there's booze... lots and lots and lots of booze... shitty pool table in the back, but it gets the job done... won $20 of EJ's bankroll on it last night... dart board that is barely hanging on, but again, serves it purpose... jukebox with a good selection... 

weird crowds though... you got your triads sitting at the end... some irishmen in the middle chatting up the pocket protector wearing asian guy donning his ear tool... hot asian bartenders... and EJ and Leif and HiDek in the back... 

Weird... Good weird.. But still weird...
author: Jen D.

description:
Nice place to chill anytime of the week!

This place is a local watering hole for people in the sunset area. Its not a hip trendy jet-set bar by any chance. More of a lounge to relax at. For the critics of this place looking for more rowdy or trendy places, try the marina district.
author: Will M.

description: This place is creepy. Stopped in here on a Friday night with my boyfriend to watch the Giants game and was totally turned off. The place itself is pretty nice. Big, nice bar, lots of big flatscreens. I was the only girl in the place besides the bartender, an Asian girl in booty shorts. The bread and butter of this place is clearly creepy middle aged guys, because several of them were seated at the bar vying for the attention of the bartender, and from the way were talking to her they seemed to be regulars. They kept buying her shots and flirting with her and she wasn't all that concerned with anyone who wasn't perving on her, which was basically just me and boyfriend. She made me the weakest drink I've ever had, it was basically just cranberry juice, and normally I would just let it go but I had to be intoxicated to deal with the atmosphere in there. So she poured me an extra shot and at least wasn't a bitch about it. I had two more drinks there that she made stronger, but never gave me a clean glass, and my boyfriend had to wait way too long to get her attention every time he wanted another beer because she was so preoccupied flirting with the creepies. I get it, they're what brings her the most money, but it shouldn't be so hard to get a friggin beer when you're sitting right at the bar. Between the bad service and the pervs making me uncomfortable, I wouldn't come back here.
author: Kelsey L.

description:
A local watering hole with Fat Tire. Big Euge has been trying to get Fat Tire on tap for 3 years he tells me. By Big Euge, I don't mean our friend neighborhood bobble head Euge.  

Dragon Lounge also carded me. Me? Little ole me. I'm still not sure what to think of that. Occasionally I get carded buying cigarettes. Occasionally I get carded buying beer at Safeway. But this is the first time I've walked in to a dark bar and been carded immediately. Was it my boyish good looks? Was it the company I walked in with? I don't know. I never did get an answer. This will haunt me. 

We ordered pizza to quell our appetites after 15 gallons of German beer. No more Taraval Pizza for me. I will go to Taco Bell or the Chinese place down the street if I ever feel the need to eat at Dragon Lounge again. See my Taraval Pizza review for more info. http://www.yelp.com/biz/kTbI2NtsXwtaPlg-wN-jqA?hrid=KsM04-5ItEY7IvIp753u6Q

Otherwise a decent experience. How can a bar with Ms. Pacman be all that bad?
author: Kevo M.

description:
The only thing I like about this bar is that the TV is out front enough so I can peek in to check the score for Giants games when I get off the MUNI.  

It's a bar for regulars... and the regulars are just a bunch of Asian dudes.  Doesn't have a fun environment or friendly feel to it.  I've walked in and the entire crowd (which is usually 6 guys) stare me up and down... and not because a female soul entered, but as if they are thinking, "Wth is this person?"  Everyone seems depressed or acting too hardup.
author: Chris T.

description: The bartender really knows how to "hook up" your drink but it's hit or miss
author: jonathan h.

description:
Interesting bar, especially if you are into the Asian scene --hairstyles and all! There is definitely an ethnic 'scene' here, but hey, that's cool with me. 

Both of the bartenders were drunk and kept spilling the drinks -- they didn't really respond to some people trying to make orders either. However, they were really nice people, so I feel bad to complain about it. For example, my friend is a real lightweight (she happens to be Chinese). She gets dizzy and all red-faced whenever she drinks. One of the bartenders came over and suggested she should get something light and take an antihistamine like benadryl before drinking. Guess its an asian thing! We got her a buttery nipple shot and that seemed to do the trick. :)

That aside, it is a mellow place to just hang. They have very comfy couches and pool tables too.

Another funny thing, they set the clock in the bar 20 minutes fast. When it hit 2, the bouncer (a skinny and tall white guy) starting kicking everyone out. We all checked our watches and it was 1:40. Oh well.
author: Prasant R.

description:
This bar is not really my ideal setting, but it was open and my friend E and I wanted a drink so...

St Patrick's day at about 3:00. One dude at the bar drinking heavily but keeping to himself. One bartender, and if it matters to you, yes attractive and nice. 

We order our beers and go to the back room to play some pool. Beer was cold, bathroom was clean. I suck at pool, but had fun. 

Decor is lounge like with velvet ottomans and lush curtains. I can't tell you what the scene is like as we were the only customers other than the one guy. Nice to have an option in the hood.
author: Amanda L.

description:
This is not a Bar. It's a Very Clean Dive, if there is such a thing. There's an immaculate pisser, and pool tables in the back. Up front, gorgeous Asian bartenders will be pouring the hard liquor. Drinks are typical -- $5 to $8 a mixed drinky.

We ended up here after the Arby's Olypmics: the few, the proud, the drunks. They didn't give us any flack for being a rowdy, loud, over-beefed dozen. (I'm sure it helped that we were with regulars.) In fact, Jason the owner bought everyone a round of Patron shots --- more than generous. Comfy seats, nice, unobtrusive staff, and a quiet out of the way Lower Sunset location make this place a good choice for hosting your own private lush party.

Four Stars it deserves, but Five cos hey, this is where the Arby's Olympiads party, yo.
author: Perci N.

description:
The first time I came here was at daytime during one of my walks.  I'm drinking my beer minding my own business when this old man starts mumbling something aggressively about giving him a ride home.  "Sorry, man I don't have a car," I say.  This just makes him start yelling at me and grabbing my arm.  He's not making any sense.  I yell at him to back the fuck off and he does for a few minutes.  He starts yelling at me again and the bartender comes and yells at him and he storms out.  One of the patrons buys me a shot and says that this is normally a nice bar.  

One of the patrons has his retarded (literally) brother or something in there and this guy comes over and starts grabbing on me and moaning.  The brother comes and wrangles him and everyone apologizes again.  

This could happen at any bar so i don't really know how to review this bar except to repeat the general rule of look out for assholes and retards.
author: Ed B.

description:
The Dragon Lounge has been for about two years since I have graduated college my kick it spot for a chill drink after a hard days work..! Now more than likely you are not going to travel from other more popular bar hoppin' districts in the city to come to a bar sitting on the quiet streets of Taraval and the Outer Sunset, but if your in the neighborhood and just want a place to kick it and have a drink than I recommend the Dragon Lounge.

So, with this drinking spot you never really know what to expect as far as the amount of occupants on any given day during the week. Mondays though they regularly have capcom vs marvel tournaments which I say attracts a nerdy crowd, but hey who am I to judge. On friday & saturday's it can get pretty filled with regulars and even young people, but for the most part this really isn't the spot to pick up chicks... Now sunday's are usually pretty dead which can leave you hanging with just you and the bartenderess, which I might add can be a good thing as with this place they are all pretty Hot! I don't know what the hiring criteria is but all the girls that work there are really attractive and it seems their attire to work really pleases the male customers. In any case they are all really friendly and work hard to make sure you are not empty on a drink. If you become a regular you may even get to know some of the bartenderess' a little bit as they are great to talk to and take shots with while at the bar (don't forget you are the one buying them the shot!). But don't get too attatched as with this place high turnover seems to be apparent. 

Other things about the bar are that it has a pool table, a good amount of surrounding t.v.'s for games and such, a jukebox ($1 for pop songs), and an actually pretty good drink menu. Now I would recommend the 'dragon extreme' as with a couple of these will definitely get you feeling buzzin' if you are a heavy weight when it comes to drinking. 

Now, as far as complaints I cannot think really of any now but it is truely a special place on Taraval that deserves your attention for a drink if you are in the area. I would say the prices are fair, the bar is cleaner than most and the bartenderess' are great especially if you do become a regular at the Dragon Lounge.
author: Gabriel V.

description:
It's a great feeling when you see a yelp sticker on the door of an establishment you happen to stumble upon.

This is how I felt as I entered the Dragon Lounge. 

We ended up here to celebrate the daily "last call". It's like midnight new year's eve everyday! Anyway...

After walking in, the friendly vibe and music enveloped me; classic soul and R&B playing from the jukebox.
A smiling bartender stood behind a long stretch bar top with plenty of open stools while pleasant local patrons relaxed and enjoyed conversations with their close friends over drinks.

I knew  I would be here till closing time.
Who cares if I had a meeting the next morning at 9AM. It was Tuesday for gosh sake....."Happy New Wednesday Everyone!"

We sat and enjoyed a couple of celebratory flaming shots and munched on some pretzels. After, we headed to the back room to play a game of pool and darts, put some money in the jukebox and ended the night by  toasting the last sips of our drinks.

Thanks Friends and Yelp - again. 

Quick synopsis- Great local place. Clean. Friendly Staff. Plenty of comfortable seating. Parking - depends on timing/day. Drink prices, very reasonable.
author: Stella B.

description: Not bad. It's a sausage fest though. Probably 95% guys (a lot of old dudes at that...), but it's a better place to just hang out and chill with a couple of friends. Drinks were made to my liking and wasn't too expensive. They have a couple of tvs at the bar area which makes a place to watch sports.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Cute neighborhood bar for those who just want a quick drink. A friend pointed out that this would be a great bar to take a date to since it's within walking distance to his house (mental note: don't get drunk with him).
Thing with this place is the front and back halfs have two different vibes. The front is where all the drinking and loud conversations are. Whereas the back is where everyone comes to sit and lounge.
Bartenders are ALL HOT GIRLS with super low tops, I have yet to see a guy make a drink in this place. Yes, I too have also ordered the infamous "Euge"... you know that sweet girly drink everyone's talking about.

There's juke box that plays everything from oldies to rap. You can even play Ms. Pac Man. Huge projection screen in the back that's almost always on ESPN. There's pool table to play a "friendly" game of cut throat.

WARNING: Police station is up the block so there's always a handful of cops having a drink. This is not the place to get hammered and jump into your car.
author: Lola L.

description:
I was heading home from a fun filled day in the City when I realized I felt like a drink (no.. not a soda).  I then realized that along the way home I will pass by Dragon Lounge.  I had recently read an article on sfgate.com about this place so I was curious. Okay... off to Dragon Lounge I go.  

Wow, I never knew it was so close to Marco Polo Ice Cream.  From the outside it looks exactly like what it is - a bar for the locals.  I go in at 5:45pm expected to see the old Fahey's bartender working.  Unfortunately its already the asian bartender.  Dont' get me wrong, I much prefer staring at a pretty asian girl than an older white guy but I wanted to see this "changing of the guard" at 6pm but I guess it doesn't apply on weekends.  Oh well, I do see some locals.  I sit down and immediately one inebriated local starts talking to me... offering up first pumps.  Hmmmm interesting.  I turn to the tv and watch the Yankee/RedSox game.  But he is a bit loud even while talking to others who are just in the next seat of him.  Hmmm time to move.  I do all the way down to the other end of the bar.  

Have me a guiness.  Hmmm  doesn't look like they know how to pour a guiness...   Okay, moving onto some scotch.  Not much of a selection of single malts.  Hmmmm  what does this place have then?  Well, it's got a pool table in the back room.  Polite friendly bartenders.  And also a nice female owner who I met and conversed with.  The crowd is definitely a bit shady looking and there were some really drunk guys at 6 in the evening (they told me they have been drinking all day long) but its a nice place to unwind.  Just not sure if it's my kinda place.
author: Wayne C.

description:
Two things:  

1. Hot bartenders- most of them friendly.

2. Rude, arrogant owner/manager who is constantly over the bartenders shoulder. 

Sadly enough my friends and I won't return to this place after numerous bad experiences there.  We even did the diplomatic thing one evening and attempted to discuss our discomfort with the owner and boy did that not go over well.  I wasn't rude nor out of line by telling the proprieter of the business that it was uncomfortable having him in the corner behind the bar glaring at us and his employees.  It created an unpleasant environment.  Constructive criticism isn't a concept yet adopted by this establishment.
author: Joel S.

description:
Pretty small place. It looks like a bar out of a chinese movie set. Greenish paint, dragon statues, lounge like seating around the bar, flat LCD TV's at both ends of the bar,  and the obligatory TV game set at one end of the bar that seems to be the trend nowadays. There is also a single pool table in the back which is always taken.

The crowd at certain hours can be seedy... or seem seedy. Mostly asian of the chinese decent. Non threatening, but they sometimes feel to be staring or putting out funky vibes. They talk amongst themselves in a lound or whatever manner, but if you are the social type, good luck in trying to strike up a convo with someone you don't know. They just didn't seem to be very approachable.

Overall though the place is a regular ol bar. Drink prices are fair, and the food is so so. Mostly CostCo forzen food prepared in the back a la microwave or oven. Usually the owner, or the owner's mother, will be at one end of the bar monitoring everything taking place behind the bar... I too have heard of some shady things about them as well in treatment of their employees, but I'll abstain on what I've "heard".
author: Jay V.

description:
Okay, you know what? Every other review here is dead-on.

Asians on weekend nights.
Teenagers.
Abysmal male:female ratio.
No dancing.

But who cares? It's our local Sunset bar, within walking distance even of most of our homes - great because it means you don't need a DD! Drinks are relatively inexpensive, and the bartenders are friendly (most of the time, but they take a lot of abuse). It is what it is. Deal with it.
author: Karl K.

description:
Well what can I say, I like me some Dragon Lounge. Yea its asian, yea its small, but so is home, but that doesn't stop me from going there either. 

Friendly bartenders and comfy place to just chill. Come kick it and enjoy. See you Thursdays!
author: Louie C.

description: I love this place.  One of the daytime bartenders, Bob, is the best.  The pretty ladies at night are friendly and fun.  I go to this place when I want to stay local, but I really want to grab a drink while I watch a game.  The only reason why I didn't give it five stars is because the Thursday daytime bartender ,Tom Daly, is awful.  He is slightly rude, smells like smoke, and talks about politics.  Avoid him at all costs.
author: Gabrielle W.

description:
Come here if you like HOT ASIAN SPINNER BARTENDERS! COME HERE IF YOU LIKE LOW PRICED ALCOHOL! 

That's why i come here! LAWL! 


Watch out if you're planning to cause some trouble, the police station is up the block!
author: Brian P.

description:
peculiar. I will not come here after 7, the bro will not set foot before 8. I guess our 12-year age gap speaks volumes.

it will always be Fahey's to me :-P
author: Prima D.

description:
its an OK lounge.

pretty nice lounge in the sunset. its mostly ALL Asians and the bar is usually packed with tons of guys trying to jock the pretty bartenders. its kinda cramped in the front of the lounge but if you keep walking, there are plenty of couches and a big screen TV, pool table and darts. 

i rather hang out here than most bars in the sunset.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I would love to give you more but you let too many wannabes into the back. Wannabes as in people that think they are hard just because they shoot pool and smoke and "try" to drink large amounts of booze. Also, trying really hard to get the bar girls to notice you...Not a pretty sight. Not when you are also trying to impress the skanks that you bring to the back. Not sure I want to play pool in the back now that I think about it...Purell should be standard at this place if my imagination turns out to be a reality.

But I am generous to give you three stars. For being open at a late time. For having two alright looking girls but most men look at their "eyes" and not the face...I guess butterfaces...And being open and allowing me to actually bump into my friend Hideki. Whom I haven't seen since I last worked at Japan Video a long time ago. Glad to see him again! Now, if you'll excuse me. I need to take a bath in Purell now that I have talked about this place...
author: Anthony L.

description:
HAHA the EUGE,
 Named after Euge,
It's such a girly drink but I like girly drinks so wasn't bad.
I don'd drink much so I give 3 stars just because my friends hang out there.
I hope you see this Euge B*atch!!! lol
Make something manly next time!
author: Peter J.

description:
When you first walk into Dragon Lounge, it feels like you're in a Jackie Chan movie where some kind of shady business is going down with the Chinese mafia in the back room. The bar is 95% filled with Chinese guys -- all looking like they're ready for a fight. Although, the drinks weren't bad and the prices were decent, I just don't enjoy the idea of having to constantly prepare myself to dive under the table in case there was going to be a highly-probable gunfight. Even when the bartender popped open a bottle of champagne, I was about to duck and shout out: "GET DOWN!!".

Maybe I'll come back next time... but not without my bulletproof vest.
author: Roy C.

description:
I can kinda agree witht he ghetto factor. Although this place isn't Smitty's in Sausalito or the ghost of the Surf Lounge in Pacifica, it still has a tinge of the ghetto vibe. 

The one thing....absolute one thing I like about this place? Getting a quick drink of pure alcohol (Rusty Nail, Double of Jack) and pouring it down the hatch before the L made it to the 24th/Taraval stop. It's a perfect way to stay warm while waiting for the train!

No comment on the bartenders...*cough, cough*
author: Dee J.

description: Not a bad place to go for drinks. The bartenders are friendly for the most part and knew how to make everything I asked for. That's all I really need. The atmosphere is chilled, and they have a lot of TVs.
author: Sara K.

description:
This was the last stop Tuesday night during our bar hop. We ended up here because a friend wanted to come here. Dragon Lounge is in a sorta dead area (at night at least), and from the outside, it can be easy to miss. This place is very clean and neat. When we came here, there was no music playing and it was awkward being at a bar and having it be all silent aside from conversations. As everyone says, the owner of this place is an old asian lady who was walking around in her sweats staring all of the patrons and her employees down. 

Anyhow, this place would be cooler if the owner wasn't constantly walking around.. I mean, you already worriedly checked our ID's and swiped them.. why walk around constantly. However, the drinks are cool here and the bartenders are hott. (yes, girls can say that other girls are hott! haha).  Probably wouldn't come here again - not really my type of scene.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
TOP SECRET BUSINESS PLAN FOR DRAGON LOUNGE
*Hire semi hot bartenders who aren't old enough to drink themselves, so they can be teases
*Play sports on the tube
*Be next to a police station so they can carry out any drunk hitting on the under age bartenders.  
*Take over an old Irish pub, because they won't care as long as there is alcohol involved. 
and finally

****be near a KFC, so after people drink they can ask their friends
"Honey do you think KFC is open?"
author: patrick o.

description:
When I was a kid, I thought that bars were for old White guys wearing trucker hats, sitting at the bar, looking shady and depressed.  In fact, the Irish pub that preceded Dragon Lounge was much like it.  I actually had a friend that lived in one of the apartments upstairs, and I still remember the sour smell of empty beer bottles firmenting in the garage.

But now, fifteen years later, there are a bunch of Asian guys at Dragon Lounge, my age and mostly younger, some wearing trucker hats, sitting at the bar looking shady and depressed.  And I realize now that having a cold drink with a friend, or sometimes even having nobody to talk to but the bartender isn't about race or depression, but simply scraping away the shit we deal in our everyday lives.

If you've got shit you want to forget about and you live around the corner, this is the place for you.
author: Tony L.

description:
Used to be Faheys when going to Linkoln. Torn down and rebuilt.
The old guys still go there in the daytime. Better than Grandma's for one thing,or two "things"-hot and nice bartenders!
The stuff on the internet box is too old for the younger set-70's,etc. R&B,so you have to pay extra to download more up to date sounds.
Prices are the usual expected-not cheap or expensive.
Bathroom is ok,clean enough.They have Becks but not Anchor.They need better snacks than just pretzels,they make enough business.
Mostly asian males in the evening after 9pm,but some females also.
author: Mag N.

description:
The bartendress was super sweet  and warned us about the drunk guy, but any owner of a bar who would not 86 a customer for fear of "losing" money even though the customer has had more then one incident of coming in and being a total jerk and is outside the establishment throwing up is not worth returning to.

p.s. it's a neighborhood bar, i'm your neighbor, yay for having to look at this guy's puke when I wait for the L line tomorrow.
author: Nici G.

description:
Another stop on the Tara-Crawl. I live around the corner but it was my first time in. I was pleasantly surprised! 

Nothing crazy to write home about though. However, they put up with all of us crazies quite well for the time we were there.
author: Beth T.

description: Dragon Lounge is the Asian bar I've never been to. I've been to Chug Pub and Bottom's Up and I can add Dragon Lounge to the list.  The feel is chill and the people have the utmost casual attitude. Even their afternoon bartender came in while we were drinking and bought us a round whatever my friends and I were drinking. The place is in the middle of neighborhood across the street of a park. It's a typical bar that I find very chill to hang out in the Sunset.
author: Matt B.

description:
It pains me greatly to give this spot only 2 stars...frankly there was a time (that pre dates Yelp, essentially) where I would have given this neighborhood watering hole 4 or 5 stars...and it's not like it's the Top of the Mark of anything...let me esplain...

This bar, for decades, was "Faheys"...a jolly Irish dive, Snooky was a great ol' Irish barman, locals (old and young) lots of Irish contractor types...just a solid place to go for Guinness and a shot or whatever you fancied, the game was always on (whether it was the 49ers or Giants or Irish hurling matches...you get the drift.  So a couple of years back, it changed hands and became "The Dragon Lounge' which, as other Yelpers who have pointed out, is just too corny of a name to stomach...even my friends of Asian ethnicity roll their eyes, but whatever, we'll check it out...it's a bar, in the Sunset, how bad can it be?
Well, at other Yelpers have aptly pointed out, it IS, basically Faheys til around 5:30 or 6pm *during the week*  then the evening bartender arrives...a pretty enough Asian gal, decent bartender, but obviously the owner wants her (and the other lady bartenders) to dress in the sluttiest clothes possible...satin hot pants and go go boots one time...SERIOUSLY!! Now, I didn't just fall off the turnip truck, I "get" that for a woman bartender, serving a largely male clientele,  it could definitely improve tips, etc....to "sex it up a bit"...got it!  But this goes way beyond that...and our group was mixed bag of men and women, different nationalities, etc...and clearly the bartender was ONLY going to listen to/cater to MALE clientele...it just felt so hookerish...and really, how is it a good business practice to be RUDE to 1/3 of the customers in attendance (it was about 70% dudes, 30% gals)?
How about, you're in a service business, be nice to everyone who will TIP you? How about, stop reinforcing every negative stereotype??  I dunno, rubbed me the wrong way...I guess I'm just nostalgic for the former vibe....now that I know better, it's very easy to make a different selection.  So for the folks who are "into this sort of thing"...have at it...
I gave it 2 stars vs 1 because of the fact its still very "Fahey-ish" before 6 AND it was clean and the drinks were fine...I just hate the after 6 vibe...so...ciao y'all!
author: Karen S.

description:
Worst White Russian I ever had. Tiny shot glass full of ice. What few drops of actual drink there are tasted like watered down cream. A complete waste of money. Other people's drinks looked marginally better. Lots of ice in everything I saw, though. 

Watering down appears to be the theme here. I have been to a few bars in my life, including all the main ones in the sunset. So I think I know what I am talking about here.

 On the plus side, the bartender was cute, and possibly drunk. Also mellow, just neighborhood people hanging out.  But this does not make up for the joke of a drink.
author: Mary G.

description:
I would come here though if i were a guy though I would come here to see the hot Asian female bartenders.  

I wouldn't come here though if I were afraid to be in a room that is 98% Asian. (Since I am Asian, I wasn't afraid, but my fiance was skeptical to come here.)

I would come here though for cheap drinks. (strong too)

I wouldn't come here for beer, as it seems like no one orders beer other than my fiance.  

I would come here for strong drinks.

I wouldn't come here for a club scene because you're not going to find it.  

I would come here though to gather a group at the little set ups and to hang out and have a good time!

I wouldn't come here to pick a fight though since the police station is like, oh a block away.  

What other reasons do you need to come here?  Now you know why to come and why to stay away.  

For me personally, I like it and will be back again.
author: Denise B.

description:
Short and sweet..

Tasty bartenders...check

Strong/good drinks...check

Jukebox that plays James Brown...mothafuckin check...HUUUUH!

Comfy...check. Got these odd couch type things up front and plenty o' room in the back.

Good for after work and during the week. Oddly I havent been there on a weekend...go fig.  I love how KFC is right up the street so you can top off a nice buzz with some death food.

Did I mention that they had some hot bartender chicks there?  Look so good I wanna pour BBQ sauce all over em' and work em' like a rib!
author: Nic K.

description: Good stiff pours on drinks and they're reasonably priced.  It's definitely a neighborhood-y vibe, and is good to have some casual drinks with friends when you're in a mood to chat.  Just a heads up that there's a police station up the block.
author: Sam W.

description:
If you're looking for a nice place to just drink, this is it. If you're looking for a more sociable crowd, not it! 
If you have a fake ID, not it either. The bouncer has that machine thing to scan your id.
Drinks are ok, hot girl bartenders.
author: Linda L.

description:
This bar used to be packed wall to wall on the weekends, but nowadays it has become my neighbor "dive bar."  Not that its dingy or anything, but it has lost some of its luster over the years.  Now it is usually filled with regulars, must of them being guys.  Good place if you are too lazy to go somewhere far for a drink or just don't feel like talking to anyone!
