You would prolly find me there for a Monday to Wednesday drink!

Pros:
- Plenty of Parking
- No fights (Police station is literally up the block)
- Cute bartenders
- Plenty of seating
- Inexpensive drinks
- Pool table
- Bar food (wings, chips n salsa, dumplings)
- Bartop Games

Cons:
- Have to keep it quiet while you are outside (since its a residential area)
- Not a real socialable crowd there
author: Eric W.

description:
Since it's only a couple miles from my house, we usually hit up Dragon lounge for a few drinks. Lots of TVs to watch sports, plenty of seats and a pool table in the back. Although I've never actually been to the back. The drinks are nice and stiff, price is reasonable too. The owner is usually sitting at the end of the bar, friendly lady.

This is not the place for you if you're motives are checking out girls. Although the bartenders are usually pretty hot, you will be surrounded by mostly all asian guys. Unless you go early enough, you'll catch some non-asian regulars. This is just like all the other bars in SF, like Fizzies, Would you believe, Nags Head.....but in sunset, mostly asian guys, cute bartenders. Great place to hang with friends and drink. but remember, the police station is 1 block away, don't do anythign stupid.
author: Jin S.

description:
If Fireside Bar is my drinking hangout then Dragon Lounge seems to be everyone else's spot. 

I only seem to go there with large groups of friends (Yes, all asian males) at really random times. Let's get the fact, that the bartenders are very attractive women, out of the way. Now, mixed drink selection is great. Not too many of my fav beers are on tap (What? An asian guy can't like Hoegaarden?!?!?)

Seating/chairs are comfortable and the general atmosphere is nice. The back pool room has pleanty of space and is probably the best seat(s) in the house (that doesn't include a pretty bartender directly in front of you). 

Parking is good, service is friendly but don't think you can act like a moron (They are located right next to the Taraval Police Station). 

Not a bad spot.
author: Brian A.

description:
Pros: 
All bartenders are girls and no office appropriate clothing after 10 (no sleeves plz)
Drinks aren't expensive
In Sunset middle of nowhere, if you live around there, best place to hang out

Conclusion: DUI is bad and bus don't stop by your neighborhood at night. If you don't mind walking down couple blocks under San Francisco wind and Sunset fog, cool place to chill with friends. (I personally circled around it couple times....Crazy cold!!...DaMN wHeRE'S mY BiKE?? oooh....I thought it was on 'that' block)
author: Raymond L.

description: This is a nice neighborhood dive bar. Cheap drinks that are fairly strong ($5 well gin and tonic). Stumbled in here drunk one Thursday night after college night at Shannon arms and realized that I've found a new place for my post-game. Definitely not the most cracking place to go and party, but it's a nice place to get really drunk before and/or after the main events of the night. Do not come in here expecting any tail; because disappointed you will be.
author: Anthony J. C.

description:
This is my first time experiencing a bar lounge in a local neighborhood in SF.  My Xo & I, his bro & his girl & her friend came here late around 1ish.  We all ordered a drink and suddenly it was already last call.  I was pretty disappointed with the drinks the bartendar made.  The drink was mainly ice with less than a shot of the main liquor.  I had to order another one and still -- my drink was still blah!  I spent alot on one drink when I should've just taken a shot instead. 

This joint is alright, pretty small with lots of seating. It is located in a corner block where you have to find street parking.  There is a pool table, a dart board  & a jukebox in another room.  If you wanted to smoke, it would have to be outside of the entrance.  Seems like alot of the Asian locals come here in which I'm not used to cause I'm from LA where it is a predominately mixed crowd.  Just an average rating for me.
author: XoXo X.

description: This bar smells like Euge's blood alcohol content.  I just take a small whiff and I'm already drunk.  There's also a bartender here with tiggo bitties.  This is a hella useful review.
author: Grace M.

description: Come here for drinks with some friends once in a while. Nothing extraordinary just a neighborhood bar. Please don't drink and drive kids especially since the police department is so close.
author: Wanster L.

description: Nice little bar in the 'Set district.  Perfect for those nites when you don't want to go Downtown or to the Richmond.  Comparable in size to some of the recent DYL bars, it's nice when there's not too big of a crowd standing in your way to the bar, jukebox, or pool table.  Drinks were cheap too.  Perfect spot to go and lounge after a big dinner.
author: JeFF T.

description:
i was literally in here for 10 minutes.. i just came in here to say hi to some friends i haven't seen in a while, and to surprise my home girl.. 

stole a few sips of her "euge" drink.. it was good!

so my first 10 minute impression of dragon lounge was pretty good.. i liked their seating and it wasn't too crowded, i'll be back another day!
author: JUDY L.

description:
So, S takes me to this place showing me around and giving me his whole autobiography of the good old days when the Asian gangsters used to pollute this area. 

LOL ... 

well, I guess that was 5 yrs ago. 

Now? Bunch of old folks, random folks just enjoying a great time. It can get obnoxiously LOUD. 

Drinks were super cheap and actually good, and the overall atmosphere? Very kick back but not my scene.

The owner and the bartenders were very chill and very sweet. 

I like how they give you pretzels to munch on... 

There's this one pac man machine next to the bathroom in the back (this was VERY useful, esp when I had to wait in line to pee NUMEROUS times, sometimes, I hate being a girl for this very reason. Some girls just go IN the bathroom to shit talk about so and so, while some girls just go just because, but damn! I had to pee!!! argh), and a jukebox where you can turn and play your music...

 Very sweet, very nice. Haha.

Tip: make sure to bring a friend who can keep you awake...
author: Jennifer S.

description:
being on the corner of taraval and 24th, you wouldn't really expect dragon lounge to be the social hub of some of the coolest kids around. but it is.

attractive bartendresses. a bunch of tv's. a pool table. comfy seating. photo hunt machine. and a tasty drink named after a tasty regular. what more could you ask for from a neighborhood bar?
author: spiff e.

description: neighborhood bar to quench the nightly thirst...seems to be a popular local bar....with local patrons sippin' beers and drinks.....games up on the screens....mellow watering hole in the sunset....bartenders the main attraction..~.^
author: Hen A.

description: I love that the old guys who frequented Fahey's still come in here, even though it's an asian teenager bar now. Makes for an interesting peoplewatching experience. I do miss Fahey's, but the Dragon Lounge is underappreciated for its cheap drinks, trampy bartenders and sports-watching TVs.
author: Megan W.

description: Weird to find a cool-ass place like this in the Sunset.  My friends and I love watching NBA, MLB, NFL games there.  Bartenders are dope.  Be careful the police station is about half a block away.
author: Jason A.

description: The bartender was hot. And that's about as much as I can say thats good about this place. I came here with some friends to get some drinks and I first ordered a snake bite which is Guinness on cider.... bartender looked at me like i was crazy because she didn't know how to make it. The owner had to tell her how to make it even after i told her how to make it... It was pretty crappy cause since she basically poured the Guinness straight into the cider, it was all mixed up and didn't have the same great taste as at other places that make it (i.e. Firefly sports bar on Noriega and 31st). Also, they charged me 7$ for that botched drink, firefly charges 5$ for it done right. Second drink I ordered an old fashioned, the bartender again had to ask the owner how to make the drink.... when she finally asked me what type of whiskey i wanted... she poured the whiskey straight into a shooter cup not a ball cup. I'm assuming she didn't put any sugar or symple syrup into it cause i could not taste it, nor did she put any angostura bitters which is a must for an old fashioned.  once she was finally done making this monstrosity she put tons of ice into the shooter glass overflowing the rest of the cup and all my drink. charged me 7$ again. I definitely wouldn't come back to this place for drinks since the two drinks i ordered besides beer and shots they fucked up. Firefly is the best Asian Bar in Parkside/Outer Sunset.
author: Eric M.

description: The bartenders are friendly and cute.  Most bartenders tend to ignore you if you're a newbie to their bar b/c they're not sure if you're a tipper or not.  These girls are fair to all customers and of couse really friendly with the regulars.  The cocktails are good.  Try the Euge, b/c it's something that they only have here.  Prices are fine and at least the bathroom is clean and that is a star by itself b/c most asian bars bathroom are so disgusting.  Even if you're sober, you would want to puke..... You can also order take-out there.. the restaurants around the area will deliver here.. so you can stay for Happy Hour and stay into the night.
author: AhLin C.

description: Predominantly Asian crowd.  All my male friends come here for the bartending eye-candies (half of which are probably not old enough to even drink, let alone handle liquor....).  Only gets crowded on Friday and Saturday nights.  And it's usually a sausage fest.
author: Liz C.

description:
this is a good place to go to when you just wanna hang out, watch sports, get drunk or all of the above. i havent been here in a year and i never realized how snooty the bartender/manager was. she wasnt very friendly. but the other girl was.  i still like this place tho. its close by my work, they have a pool table in the back, a jukebox (music is a little outdated),  they  serve food, drinks are at a reasonable price, and they also have TVs!! any bar with flatscreen tv's is a plus!  parking is a bitch around here so you'll have to find street parking.  

 i ordered a snakebite. but they didnt make it the way i like it.  instead of using pear cider, they used irish cider. so my snakebite didnt taste that good. i mean, it was "so-so." 

they also have this drink called "euge." so heres the story behind this drink.  forgive me if i'm not telling it right...so its named after some douchebag that kept ordering pussy drinks all night. i guess he was super drunk and instead of calling it by its proper name which is "lychee drink" or some shit,  he just started calling it by his own name "euge." (bartender said his real name is eugene). and so they named it after him. anyway, it has parrot bay mango rum, pineapple juice, and redbull. its actually pretty good. it reminds me of those tiny jello cups that you buy at asian markets. its kind of  sweet and  its supposed to taste like lychee.

this place is definately a good place to have get-togethers or birthdays. all the times that i've been here, it wasnt too busy. but i'll definately be back. maybe i'll order a "euge." hahah.
author: B B.

description: Catch me here mid-week.  Sounds gangsta, I know.  Don't be scared.  Two reasons to go.  Hot bartender and Hennessy Privilege is their standard "gnac".  I guess that would be three things. *WINK*
author: Tommy O.

description: Solid neighborhood bar!  I was introduced to this place by a friend... we decided to stop here after having some drinks prior.  We didn't get to stay too long, but the place was clean, had plenty of seating, and can I say one cute cute cute cute cute girl who worked behind the counter!
author: Eric P.

description: Quite ghetto and the bar tender is not pretty. Drinks are pricey and there aren't many people around. There is a pool table, I guess thats cool too.
author: Keit K.

description: (3.5 Stars) As much as I think blue velvet did not match well with the Sunset, I have to hand it to the owners.  Place looks pretty upscale inside.  I have had a good time the few times I have been here, I just wish my wallet could hold more...wait, they take credit too.  You just need a bunch of ones for the bar tenders.
author: Kapeli M.

description: This is not a bad place to hang out once in a while. It was my bday so I had my fair share of drinks. The back room seated my friends and I and we just played drinking games. I would come back
author: Gordon L.

description: "Eclectic" mix of super hot asian bartenders and old white dudes. Cool seating in the back - we had the place to ourselves Wednesday night. Good place to shoot pool and chill out.
author: haley d.

description: Pretty chilled out place to grab a few drinks.  You got the cute asian bartenders and you got the pool tables and tvs to keep you occupied.
author: Sam T.

description:
you lookin' for a thursday hangout where the only girl is the ditzy young asian girl bartender? then this is your place!

pool tables, heavy pours, fruit files on the spouts of hennessey bottle, and no lag time gettin' a drink.
author: Ameer N.

description: Chill ass place in da sunset! The atmosphere is great and the people you meet there can be quite interesting. Bartenders are dope and hella friendly...holla at AQ if you want some drinks served up roite! Get at me!
author: dave s.

description: Our girl bartender was really nice. We went on a Thursday night before last call I believe, and it was almost dead. There were two other guys in the front bar area and a group in the back playing pool. The bar itself was pretty decent and looked to be clean enough. The drinks were not strong though. We ordered a melon ball, which was very weak in color and taste. My friend is usually a fan, but she didn't like this one very much. The malibu pineapple tasted much better, even better than I last remembered at another bar. However, it wasn't very strong either. I don't believe they shake their drinks, but that's probably the case for some other bars as well. The drinks were pretty cheap, about $5 or $6 a piece.
author: Elaine H.

description: Overall, this bar is a good place to just hang out in, reminisce or have a few after work with your friends... No need to dress to impress, wait in line, etc. It's definitely a local spot for I have had my experiences with the overly populated, touristy, high maintenance spots around Financial District, Union Square, etc. Though, I have to add that when you look at the bar from the outside...it looks shady & hidden enough to think that there were some illegal gambling, prostitution behind  closed doors...btw, I loved the pineapple martini but the bartender needed to be generous with it...c'mon half a martini glass? I was done after 3 sips?? The seats (or ottomans) near the wall were great because you can just sit and watch sports on TV or people that pass you by...
author: Charmian D.

description: Great places are made by great people. I've met some of the good ones here, of course, while a tad bit intoxicated. Four stars because of the capacity. A lot of people are starting to overflow this place because of the widespread rumors and they might need to start expanding. Otherwise, it would be perfect! This bar is located on a nice little corner pocket with quasi-decent parking. Like my ever-so-awesome sister Nancy W. has explained, the majority of the crowd is reflective of the community.
author: Ryan R.

description: What's not to like? A local bar with pretty bartenders that warm up once they get to know you. Im biased I guess because Im a semi-regular. Everyone has their fave bar...this one happens to my regular one at the moment.
author: Dustin L.

description: Great neighborhood bar, nothing but cute asian bartenders, and great space. The bartenders are very friendly-and drinks are very reasonable and strong. I will pass by here whenever I'm in the neghborhood. Points for the pool table & jukebox.
author: Dessa R.

description:
First things first...things to address.....what I like.....what people don't like........and my experience. The bouncer guy is rather intimidating but I never had a problem with him....so most of the time we're just like boats passing each other in the middle of the night. Other than that...
*they accept cc, 
they have an atm, 
**clean bathrooms, 
some weird electronic bar games, 
***a jukebox, 
****a pool table in the back, 
some other drinking games with dice that I never figured out how to play,
*****some funky seats that I have come to love, 
they do serve some food there, 
*****they always let me and my crew bring in pizzas from down the street, 
*****and the lounge-like atmosphere considering the place reminds of Cheers for some reason....... 
*****but imagine instead of Sam Malone behind the bar there are instead possibly 3 fairly well endowed bar mistresses.....and just in case if you are wondering I don't spit game at them...I just talk to them as I would anyone else who is serving me alcoholic beverages 
;D

:( - I can say that I don't really care.....for the street parking...up till now I've always been lucky but I'm sure one of these days I'm going to have to park far away and I can tell you now that I will not enjoy it. Not to mention that I don't care for the close proximity to the police station....but maybe that's a good thing. 

Grant it that the establishment does cater - whether intentionally so I do not know - to a lot of asians. I admit that I have heard of the place because of my asian acquaintances. Mind you some of them live in the area so I think that makes me a local by association. And I never really thought about how other people at the bar view us...because yes...generally, and probably we're are the said "asians" yelling at each other playing games, pool sharking in the back, dragging our knuckles, or whatever comment was made about a group of asian males. And correction, not all of us in the entourage are asian or young for that matter....most of the time our supervisor takes out there. 

We don't do it intentionally....we just happen to be a bunch of fun loving guys who get together and have an amazing time at an amazing place - it doesn't hurt that some of us know the owner....is a brother of one of the bar mistresses, and if you look carefully behind the counter there are trophy plaques with one of our guys' name on it. Mind you that I am not any of those people...rather I'm just a guy who happened to used to work with all of them. We're actually a bunch of loud nice guys if you ever get to know us. The other groups of asian males on the other hand are a bunch of a**h*les!!! lmao 
But no, not us. ;D

So if you can handle.....the amazingly nice but intimidating bouncer guy, us loud group of asian males, the bad parking, and I suppose lack of happy hour then this place isn't half bad....actually it is more than half great.
author: John-Michael C.

description: Drinks are cheap but this place used to be a lot better.  There used to be a lot more bartenders.  Whites are  accepted although I get the feeling frowned upon.
author: Marc M.

description: Everytime I come here, I leave with a happy face. Bartenders are hot and very nice. Always fun to talk to, of course dont bug them when it's busy. This place is small, but plunty of seating with plunty of stuff to do in the back. Drinks are great and prices are average.
author: David M.

description:
This is one of the worst bars I've ever been to. And sadly one of the closest bars to my house...

There's a mean old woman, the owner I'm sure, who sits back and watches the children- oops, sorry I meant bartenders- like a hawk.  These poor girls are all super young and have to wear skanky clothes, and have absolutely no clue what they're doing behind a bar. 
And the drinks are overpriced. 

The old lady came over and checked our table for empty glasses no less than 3 times during the 15 minutes or so we were there, and was obvious about her desire to have us leave. Kept picking up people's not quite empty glasses to try to rush us out of the bar!

They have a $20 minimum for cards, so when my too-drunk friend went to pay his tab and wanted to pay with cash since he only had $9 on his tab, they took advantage of his drunkenness, wouldn't let him pay with cash, and added an $11 drink for the bartender onto his tab, to bring it up to $20. When the rest of us (we were all pretty much sober except the one poor guy who went alone to deal with his tab) came to his rescue and questioned why he got charged $20, the timid bartender said he bought her a drink, and seeing her bartender being asked a simple question, the scary looking owner came over. She claimed that the $11 Mai Tai (!!!) had already been made and drank by her bartender (not true!) so my friend had to pay for it. When I pointed out that it's illegal for bartenders to drink on the job, she just said "everyone does it."  You mean everyone who bribes the cops to not pay attention to their shady-ass bar dealings? (just a guess but it seemed like the kind of place)

Anyway, I feel sorry for the girls who work there. They seemed very sweet when hawk-lady wasn't watching, and seemed relieved when I ordered at the bar, as though thankful not to have to deal with their drunk old-men customers for 30 seconds. This is definitely an exaggeration, but I felt like I was in some weird asian brothel, with the madame watching over her girls to make sure they didn't get too friendly with the customers unless they were making her money by doing so.  Absolutely awful place!
author: Brandi C.

description: Cute bartendars they have a pool table and its a fairly nice place. The biggest plus is its by my house. Only been there a few times never on the weekend and on the few occasions I've gone its been with friends on a random weeknight since they know I live right near there.
author: Hyung L.

description: Cute bartenders, lots of dude customers on a friday night calls for lots of flirting with the bartenders.  Majority of the people that go here are Asian and its pretty much a hangout here after a long week of work and want to get a couple of drinks in their system.  They have a couple of pool tables and good number of TVs along with some tables alongside with the bar.  Except for the bartenders not a lot of eye candy to look at.
author: Kris A.

description:
Despite its proximity to my house I haven't gone there as much as I had expected I would upon discovery. Simple reality of living in San Francisco, there are way too many options to limit yourself. Even so, it's nice to have a place where upon entry there is a smile of familiarity. 

This is particularly impressive when the bearer of said smile has only seen you once.

After a long hiatus, I returned for the first time on a Saturday night to find 2 girls working the bar. I chatted up one more than the other if for no other reason than I'd talked to her before. It was a pleasant time despite being surrounded by guys who were absolutely convinced they would be the ones to score with these girls. 

Okay, it's not like that fantasy hasn't crossed my mind, but I know the reality of the situation. Besides they're really nice and there's something appealing about having a pretty bartender looking out for her customer/friend. Good vibes there which I can live with.

Well it got interesting last night (no, not like that). I'd had a particularly bad day at work (believe me when I say bad does not begin to cover just how miserable I felt). Alone, I needed not to be at home so I dropped in here to find a little time alone NOT thinking. Of course what better to help NOT thinking than with a cold drink in your hand and a pretty face behind the bar?

Tonight it was Joyce to whom I'd never spoken beyond a few bar bit exchanges. 

Nothing major happened. Nothing world changing. No big romantic look across the room. Just a smile and a little basic chit chat, but that was enough to realign things in my world to let me know that are still good things around. 

I don't know if this really qualifies as a review, but I guess if you're looking for a place where the solitude does not equate isolation and a pretty smile does it for you, then you should be here.
author: Phil T.

description: my home away from home. nicest bartenders in town. very mellow place compared to most of sf asian bars. they have a drink named after me there. hahaahah yep im an alchy.
author: Euge L.

description: cool mellow place to have a drink or two with some friends. Be sure to say hi and be nice to my friend Rowie and joyce....
author: joseph t.

description: talk about coyote ugly for the asian persuasion.  their mixed drinks are pretty good (try the lychee martini).  the boobs, i mean, girls serving drinks are what some would call hawt (not me) but whatev.  i think they have some sort of senior citizen happy hour during the day because before 5, everyone in that joint is 40 & up.  the best thing about this place- the pool table is always open.
author: rachface -.

description: the bartenders there have some tig ol' tatties...damn even poppin out and lettin the cool breeze blow by them for quite a few min...and then the puppies are put away...great place when u wanna keep ur glances below eye and chin level!!
author: Stephanie P.

description: wow, pretty bartender girls.  and friendly too.  and drinks are soooo cheap.  this is heaven.
author: Bryan K.

description: dreadful ... unclean bar, who gives a s*** bartender, go elsewhere
author: tim y.

description: Asian bar catering to the young Asian crowd.  Drinks aren't all that cheap but it's a neighborhood bar, so you go there for convenience.  Good place to just go for a drink and chat with friends.  Police station's right across the street.  You can't be too noisy when you smoke outside though or the security guy will tell you to shut up for disturbing the neighbors.
author: Mich C.

description: Fahey's it ain't anymore.......whats funny is I'm a frequenter of the Irish bars, pubs, eateries, men, *sigh*  whatever, I'M THERE......So I always knew it as Fahey's and when it changed to the DL I vowed to never go in......not my scene Ya dig??? Eventually (as I can be easily persuaded) a couple of friends got me to go in and I had to start laughing.......the end of the bar where I met the guys was nuttin but Irishmen laughing and cursin at each other talking about the days work or who was completely trashed last night....THE other end of the bar was all youngish Asian guys with the exception of the two who were probably about 150 combined.....So i plopped myself down with the guys met the bartenders......Mai (I'm not sure how in the hell to spell that) and Amanda are two of the most smokinist hottest (think super hot anime girls in tight black tank tops) chics Ive seen behind the bar........( still not anywhere near our Sunday night bartenders but eh...its a different place).  TAKE WARNING THOUGH....if they like you...you will end up plowed beyond belief wondering how the hell you re gonna make it all the way home.......the girls are great......Ive been in there enough times now that they know my drink they know my name they know who I come in there with.......and the know a few of my secrets.....EXACTLY WHY I do not come in there with anyone......Still not a bar I wanna make my "spot" but for once in awhile it is a cool place
author: Shaunna K.

description: I like this place for a quick beer or 2 before I hit up a club or club/bar. The bartenders are really really good looking Asian women that are out of their way friendly. They like to talk to you as they get your drink and even offer pretzels. The music was pretty good too. I don't know if it was a jukebox or Ipod.
author: lance l.

description: good stiff drinks. im used to LC being just 151 and jager. they fill will Goldshlager then top off with 151. Guiness is pretty luke warm.  Bartenders are always pretty and sweet. Crowd are usually young adult asian crowd, what dya expect from the name "DragonLounge" in the sunset.  eh? cheap drinks purdy bartenders and great company. It was a good night.
author: JASON L.
